questions.question: Dogstar is an American alternative rock band formed in Los Angeles in 1991. The band's success over the years has been overshadowed by the fact that their bassist is a famous Hollywood celebrity who started his career in Canadian television. Name the celebrity.
Diamond is the hardest mineral on the Mohs Hardness scale. Which mineral, once commonly used in households, is the softest?
Which company's first product was a line of playing cards in 1889?

It began as an attempt at creating textured wallpaper. But when Alfred Fielding and Marc Chavannes put two pieces of plastic shower curtains through a heat-sealing machine, the product was something peculiar. Which accidental invention, that helped IBM bring its computers to customers, soon revolutionised the packaging industry?
Which wildly used term was introduced to internet parlance by Lou Montalli of Netscape Communications in 1994, which is also an eatable item?
Which Indian brand was started by Jaysukh Patel, O.R. Patel and Manubhai Patel?
Which word comes from the Roman term meaning 'twice-cooked'?

A kind of cognitive bias where a person overvalues something they helped create. The idea being that 'labour alone can be sufficient to induce greater liking for the fruits of one's labour'. How is this cognitive bias better known as?
Jean-Baptiste Say coined this term in 1800, which means 'one who undertakes an enterprise'. Which popular term is it?
Which was the first product to be scanned with a barcode?
Danjaq LLC is the holding company responsible for the copyright and trademarks to the characters, elements and other materials related to what?
Which popular business term was first coined by Sir Walter Scott in his famous novel 'Ivanhoe'?
Which American shoe company is named after a corn dish used to feed pet dogs?
Which certification denotes that child labour has not been used in the manufacturing of carpets?
Harrah's Entertainment Inc. founded on October 30, 1937 as a small bingo parlor in Nevada, operated by William F. Harrah, became the first company in which type of business?
What was first created by Suaing Ching, extensively used by US Army in 1945, and currently used by corporates as a training tool?
What resulted in 1937 after Lt. John McCready had returned from a Balloon flying adventure and the sun had done permanent damage to his eyes?
What were introduced by Harry Burnett Lumsden and William Stephen Raikes Hodson in 1848 for the British colonial troops in India and were found to be specially effective for field service and battle?
Which brand name was suggested by Dhirajben Ruparel, in a contest held for the purpose, with prize money of Rs. 5?
Which company was the official supplier of uniforms to the SA, SS, Hitler Youth, NSKK, and other Nazi Party organisations?
What is the act of 'persisting with an idea even after it no longer remains profitable' called, that shares its name with a famous name in aviation?
Percy Spencer noticed the melting of a peanut candy bar that he had in his pocket while working on an active radar set. What famous appliance came out as a result of this incident?
What was added to the Morse Code on 24th May, 2004, on its 160th Anniversary?

This term is derived from the practice in Renaissance Italy where moneylenders conducted business from benches in public places, and if they became insolvent, their bench would be broken to symbolize their failure to meet financial obligations. Which term?
questions.explanation: The word entered English via Middle French banqueroute, which itself derived from the Italian bancarotta, combining banca (bench) and rotta (broken).

questions.question: The name of which enclosure is derived from the Greek unit of measurement for the distance covered in six hundred feet?
After which part of a bird’s anatomy was the strategic salient in Jammu, between the Chenab and the Chander Bagher, named ?
What term derived from the Greek word meaning ‘Authority’ was first used to describe the dominance of Athens over other Greek city states?
Which term, literally meaning ‘sand’ in Latin, was used for the sand-strewn central area of a Roman amphitheatre?
The name of which tourist destination in India is derived from the Malay word for the Hindu God Hanuman?
Lush Cosmetics of UK has a product named 'Smuggler's Soul', which they promote with the picture of an Indian. Which infamous Indian?

This word to describe a hero, has its origin in the Latin word for a flat ground. The heroes showcased their military prowess on flat open grounds. Now a days, it is used to describe someone with great skills in any field.
questions.explanation: Comes from the Latin word 'campus' meaning open/plain field.

questions.question: Coined by the author Robert A. Heinlein, the term 'X' first appeared in his science fiction novel 'Stranger in a Strange Land'. It tells the story of Valentine Michael Smith, a human who comes to Earth in his early adulthood after being born on the planet Mars. 'X' means to understand something deeply, intuitively, and completely. It is also the name of one of Elon Musk's projects. Identify 'X'.

In the early 90s, a group of computer scientists working in a building at the University of Cambridge grew frustrated with a specific daily annoyance: walking down a hallway only to discover that the coffee pot was already empty. To solve this, the “Trojan Room Coffee Camera” was created to provide a live view of a shared coffee pot, allowing researchers to avoid wasted trips to an empty machine.  This innovation, though humble in intention, ended up being a quiet landmark in tech history. It was the first time a continuous video feed was shared over a network. What invention did this lead to?
questions.explanation: The Trojan Room Coffee Pot camera (1991) at Cambridge is widely regarded as the birth of the webcam — the first live video feed streamed over a network.

questions.question: Describing why the crow is this publication’s icon, its editor wrote: 'It is the brainchild of Prasoon Joshi, Chairman of McCann Erickson, who brilliantly intuited the old proverb, 'Jhooth Bole Kauwa Kaate', for the paper’s ad campaign. Identify the publication.
questions.explanation: Tehelka's editor explained their crow icon as rooted in the proverb 'Jhooth bole, kauwa kaate' — if someone lies, the crow will peck them — to symbolise fearless truth-telling.

questions.question:
In ancient India, X was originally known as Moksha Patam. It was designed not for amusement, but for contemplation – a quiet lesson in karma. As one advanced, virtues like kindness and honesty lifted them towards liberation; vices like lust or arrogance pulled them down towards endless rebirth. Used by teachers and monks alike, it mapped the moral terrain of life – with progress and setbacks governed not by skill, but by fate.
Centuries later, X would lose its spiritual intent and become a pastime found in homes and waiting rooms around the world. Identify X.
questions.explanation: Originally Moksha Patam in ancient India — a game of moral instruction about karma, virtue, and liberation — later globalized and stripped of its spiritual meaning into the children’s board game we know today.
